header.title: The Roots and Consequences of Ageism in America
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: What is the root of ageism in our society? Dr. Bill Thomas argues that our society venerates and idealizes youth while ignoring elders with real lived experience and making them virtually invisible.. . This excerpt comes from the documentary Aging Matters by Nashville Public Television, exploring the changing face of aging and what our community faces as the baby boomer generation grows the over 65 population to unprecedented numbers. Watch the full episode here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qr1_7...
header.socioLingVar: Age - General,Age - Over 65s,Gender - General,Ethnicity - General,Social Class - Working class

commentThread.commentText: World-wide, we live in societies that mainly perpetuates the idea of young male strength through the military and sports which dominates all cultures. From an early age, females are socialized into weak and passive roles. When they are adults, the majority are invisible to power jobs or governmental participation although a few become tokens, most often, if they inherit wealth. Ageism is practiced more severely against women because men are more prepared financially in thei r senior years. Also, the media and social norms generate the notion that males maintain the ir sex appeal and virility in that they can produce sperm to produce offspring with younger females while women of the s ame age are unproductive. US President Trump married and conceived a son wi th a woman that was 24 years younger than he was and maintains the most important job in government even though he is 71 years old. Through history and presently, wars and crimes are commonly committed by males, who unyielding do minant woman and the world, at any age. It's ironic that the females, who are restrained and devalued, outlive the males.
but some people still strong and healthy . it all depends how u take care urself .
The old want to hold the young back and the young want the old out of the way.

It's interesting how White elderly folks complain about experiencing ageism. Now they understand that prejudice isn't a myth. Now they understand what w e ethnic minority groups go through all our lives, even when we were younger.
If people were more collectivistic and interdependent on each other, then elders would be seen as experienced and wise.
Affects just old people ?? NO I am afraid it affects even younger people, for example in my case young people who are 5 or more years younger than me avoid having anything to do with me.

Ageism doesn't just apply to physiologically old people it also applies to young people as well i would say more so even than older people, many young people are far more intelligent than their older counterparts but are dismissed because of age without anyone ever having considered their arguments.

replies.commentText: I hate that it always comes down to older verses younger.  The two were never meant to be competition as all people who live long enough will be both.

Are you stupid ?! Oh sorry of course you are you sound very young. Most problems in the west come from young people did you ever hear the saying revolutions are build on the back of the young ?? They are naive and easy to manipulate why do you think they are being promoted so heavily they don't spare a thought for the future. You act on your emotions look around you we live in a world where feelings are more important than fact!

commentThread.commentText: Ageism is the only widely accepted prejudice in the world. It's wrong. It short changes everyone. I believe I can learn something from everyone from infant to centarians. All people have value.

replies.commentText: Yes it really does effect young & old alike. I made an objective video about Ageism on my page, I think you'd enjoy it.

commentThread.commentText: My only worry is that I can still be able to have some kind independence. Such as being able to walk around with no support and being able to remember things well enough. Other than that I'm fine with getting older.
Ageism its so ridiculous and irrational that it serious piss me off badly. I wonder, Does people of twenty´s know that some day they will be the old ones?. Im 34 by the way.

replies.commentText: Ageism happens to younger people too. Particularly people age 18-20. They're quite demonized by laws and regulations. (Harsh DMV punishments on youth, can't drink, can't own handguns, can't adopt, can't rent a car, can't rent a hotel room, can't go to a casino, can't be public officials or police officers, BUT they can die for their country).

I'm 27 and when I told a few teens my age, they said I was old, which made me feel bad, because I don't fee l old. I think that's probably a common experience throughout life, when people just label you that way. It's a terrible mentality. I never felt that way about anyone when I was younger. I hope as we go forward people realize the narrow-mindedness of the way they treat people, and change their ways.

commentThread.commentText: This is good stuff!  I intend to share this with the paramedic class I teach.  Over 30% of our patients in EMS are over the age of 65 and I believe we make far too many assumptions when we deal with different age groups.
